name: brave-search
description: Brave Search API for web and news source discovery across the open internet

tools.name: brave_web_search
tools.description: Search the web for sources, articles, reports, and data relevant to the research question

parameters.count: Number of results to return (default: 10, max: 20)
parameters.freshness: Filter by recency: pd (past day), pw (past week), pm (past month), py (past year)

tools.name: brave_news_search
tools.description: Search recent news articles for current events, announcements, and market developments

parameters.freshness: Filter by recency: pd (past day), pw (past week), pm (past month)

tools.name: brave_suggest
tools.description: Get search query suggestions for expanding research scope

parameters.query: Partial query to get suggestions for

use_cases: General web source discovery for market, competitive, and technology research
News search for recent developments, announcements, and press coverage
Company research: press releases, product launches, executive statements
Industry report discovery from analyst firms and research organizations
Competitor intelligence: pricing pages, feature lists, customer reviews
Fact-checking: verifying source URLs and cross-checking claim accuracy
team_integration: The Source Analyst uses Brave Search as the primary web discovery tool. For each research sub-question, the Source Analyst executes 3-5 search queries with different formulations and follows citation chains from high-relevance results. The Fact Checker uses Brave Search to verify source URLs and cross-check claims against live web sources. A typical research study consumes 50-200 search queries depending on depth.
notes: Brave Search is required for all research modes. The free tier (2,000 queries/month) is sufficient for 10-40 research studies per month depending on depth configuration. For teams running research at higher volume, upgrade to a paid tier. Deep research (sources.depth: deep) may consume 100-200 queries per study.
